alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Grove City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Worthington, Bexley, Groveport, Ohio State University, Whitehall, Grandview Heights, Obetz, Urbancrest, Valleyview, Marble Cliff, Riverlea, Brice, Port Columbus Airport, Blacklick Estates and Clintonville. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 92 and 111. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 94 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
